com.agorapulse.permissions

Interface PermissionAdvisor<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of the objects which permissions are being checked
    All Superinterfaces:
    io.micronaut.core.order.Ordered
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    GrantsPermissionAdvisor

    public interface PermissionAdvisor<T>
extends io.micronaut.core.order.Ordered
    The permission advisor checks the permissions for the given object and the current execution context.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface io.micronaut.core.order.Ordered

        HIGHEST_PRECEDENCE, LOWEST_PRECEDENCE

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      io.micronaut.core.type.Argument<T> argumentType() 
      PermissionCheckResult checkPermissions(String permissionDefinition, T value, io.micronaut.core.type.Argument<T> argument)
      Checks whether the operation described by the permissionDefinition can be executed within current execution context on the value object.

      • Methods inherited from interface io.micronaut.core.order.Ordered

        getOrder

    • Method Detail

      • argumentType

        io.micronaut.core.type.Argument<T> argumentType()
        Returns:
        the argument type of the objects being checked

      • checkPermissions

        PermissionCheckResult checkPermissions(String permissionDefinition,
                                       T value,
                                       io.micronaut.core.type.Argument<T> argument)
        Checks whether the operation described by the permissionDefinition can be executed within current execution context on the value object.
        Parameters:
        permissionDefinition - the string definition of the permission which are being evaluated
        value - the current value being evaluated
        argument - the argument with can be source of additional metadata such as annotations being present
        Returns:
        ALLOW if the operation is allowed, DENY if the operation is forbidden or UNKNOWN if the result cannot be decided
